item.title: Taha add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "If you only read the books that everyone else is reading, you can only think what everyone else is thinking." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Taha add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Memories warm you up from the inside. But they also tear you apart." -- Haruki Murakami

item.title: Taha add a quote by Romain Gary
item.description: "I've had a lot of fun. Good-bye, and thank you." -- Romain Gary

item.title: Taha add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is nothing to writing. All you do is sit down at a typewriter and bleed." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Taha add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "Happiness in intelligent people is the rarest thing I know." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Taha add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "There is no friend as loyal as a book." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Taha add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
Taha add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "It's funny. All you have to do is say something nobody understands and they'll do practically anything you want them to." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Taha add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Iâ€™m an atheist and I thank God for it." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Taha add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "When a stupid man is doing something he is ashamed of, he always declares that it is his duty." -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Taha add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "Be yourself; everyone else is already taken." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Taha add a quote by Haruki Murakami
item.description: "Memories and thoughts age, just as people do. But certain thoughts can never age, and certain memories can never fade." -- Haruki Murakami
